remarks: If ` Y ` is an ` R ` , ` A ` transitive predecessor, then it is either an immediate predecessor or there is a transitive predecessor between ` Y ` and ` X ` .  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 9-May-2012.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
statement:
trpredrec $p |- ( ( X e. A /\ R Se A ) -> ( Y e. TrPred ( R , A , X ) -> ( Y e. Pred ( R , A , X ) \/ E. z e. TrPred ( R , A , X ) Y R z ) ) ) $.
$d A z $.
$d R z $.
$d X z $.
$d Y z $.
